snippet: Newly unveiled changes could have significant consequences for judges, lawyers and the hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers charged with low-level violations each year.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio unveils reform package aimed at clearing state court backlogs that keep hundreds of people locked up for years without being convicted; measures designed to make summons process easier for both courts and recipients include calls and text messages reminding people of court dates and publishing of summons enforcement data broken down by precinct and race.
lead_paragraph: Newly unveiled changes could have significant consequences for judges, lawyers and the hundreds of thousands of New Yorkers charged with low-level violations each year.

headline.main: New York City Plans to Transform Summons Process
headline.print_headline: City Plans to Transform the Summons Process
